title: Replace Family Chat primary flow with signed-in New App placeholder

requirements.summary: Replace the signed-in primary flow with a dedicated “New App” placeholder screen and remove navigation access to Chat/Family Settings.
acceptanceCriteria: After signing in, the app shows a dedicated “New App” placeholder screen instead of the ChatPage/FamilySettingsPage views.
The AppShell navigation does not provide routes/tabs/buttons to the existing chat or family settings screens.
All user-facing text on the placeholder screen is in English.
The app still builds and runs with the existing React + React Query + Internet Identity setup (no edits required to immutable hook/provider files).

file_operations.description: Create a signed-in “New App” placeholder page that clearly signals a fresh starting point. Use shadcn-ui components (e.g., Card, Button, Alert) for consistent styling; verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

Wire the app’s authenticated content to render the new NewAppPlaceholderPage as the primary post-sign-in view, and remove the ChatPage/FamilySettingsPage view-switching from the main flow so those screens are no longer reachable from normal navigation.

Remove Chat/Settings navigation controls and related view-switching props, and update header branding to reflect the new “New App” experience while keeping existing InstallEntryPoint and LoginButton. Use existing shadcn-ui Button/Separator where needed; verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

requirements.summary: Add a client-side-only “What do you want to build?” multi-line input with a primary CTA that confirms capture locally.
acceptanceCriteria: The placeholder screen includes a text input (multi-line) labeled in English (e.g., “Describe your app”).
Typing into the input updates local state and is preserved while the user stays on the page.
A primary button (English label) is present; clicking it shows an on-screen confirmation (e.g., inline alert) that the description was captured (no backend calls).

file_operations.description: Implement a labeled multi-line input bound to local component state and a primary CTA button that, when clicked, shows an inline confirmation message (no backend calls). Prefer shadcn-ui Textarea/Button/Alert for UI consistency; verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
